numbered_ace_sentences: 1. In most countries, people who are 15 to 24 years old are more likely to be satisfied with the progress of improving the world than people who are older than 40 years.
2. Some countries are close to the black line.
3. Indonesia is a country.
4. India is a country.
5. Nigeria is a country.
6. Bangladesh is a country.
7. Morocco is a country.
8. Mali is a country.
9. In these countries, the difference between generations is relatively small.
10. In Brazil, relatively few people are satisfied with the world.
11. In Mali, relatively few people are satisfied with the world.
12. In Brazil, relatively few people have a hopeful view of the future.
13. In Mali, relatively few people have a hopeful view of the future.
14. In Indonesia, people are hopeful about progress in the past few years.
15. In Indonesia, this is true for every generation.
16. Some countries have a high percentage of satisfaction in every generation.
17. These countries are not fully developed countries.
18. Some developed countries lead the world economy.
19. The United States is a developed country.
20. Germany is a developed country.
21. The United Kingdom is a developed country.
22. These developed countries are located in the middle part of the graph.
23. I wonder about a specific structure of a country that impacts people to build a view of society.
24. I wonder about a specific environment of a country that impacts people to build a view of society.
25. The United States influences the younger generation to have a positive view of the world.
26. In the United States, the older generation tends to view the future negatively.
27. The younger generation and the older generation live at the same time in the United States.
28. The graph shows a society.
29. I spent most of my life in this society.
30. In this society, the younger generation has a more positive view of the world than people who are older than 40 years.
31. I ask whether the world is getting better.
